DOC.brief_summary: Monocentric comparative group study comparing the efficacy and short-term tolerance of a propulsion type oral appliance (Herbst) with a retention type device (ORM) used in the treatment of sleep apnea syndrome. The investigators hypothesized both appliances would be equally effective and tolerated.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Two Oral Appliances in the Treatment of Sleep Apnea Syndrome
DOC.criteria: Sufficient teeth to allow wearing of the device Mild to severe OSAS Ability to answer the questionnaires No concomitant CPAP treatment BMI inferior to 32 kg/m2 Important dental or parodontal disease Central sleep apnea Jaw opening limitations Temporomandibular joint dysfunction Major gag reflex precluding the longterm use of the device Major or unstable cardiovascular or pulmonary disease
